quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Number and Mets
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, rookie, jason. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Lebron James led the Cleveland Cavaliers into the NBA Finals in 2007.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The catcher Gary Carter, who wore number 8, was a powerful hitter.  He sent one over the green monster at Fenway Park during the World Series.  Which team did the Mets acquire him from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Montreal Expos

questions.question: This most popular skiing style, offered by many resorts, is used for recreation among both professionals and non-professionals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alpine skiing

questions.question: In dogsled racing, a timed competition of teams consisting of a number of sleddogs and a dog driver, what is the name of the short neckline snapped to each dog’s collar?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: neckline

questions.question: Jason Kidd won the MVP Award in 2003.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Mets won how many regular season games en route to their postseason and title?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 108

questions.question: Tim Duncan was the MVP in 2001 and 2002.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Tracy McGrady used to play for the Toronto Raptors.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Steve Nash won the 2004-2005 Most Valuable Player Award.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Shaquille Oneal won the Rookie of the Year Award in 1992.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Kobe Bryant scored 81 points against the Toronto Raptors on January 22 2006.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Dwyane Wade won the NBA Finals MVP Award in 2006.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Kevin Garnett has never won the MVP Award.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This winter sport is the second fastest non-motorized sport on Earth, after speed skydiving.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Speed skiing

questions.question: Yao MIng was the first ever number one draft pick from Asia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Sport and Mets
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, parkour, fiction. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: According to the rules of the International Skating Union, major speed skating competitions can be held  on outdoor or indoor ice ovals, of what standard length?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 400 m (1,310 ft)

questions.question: Who served as the Mets pitching coach in 1986?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mel Stottlemeyer

questions.question: Which team did the Mets beat to win the NL pennant and reach the World Series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Houston Astros

questions.question: Who screamed the now famous words, Struck em out! Struck em out! The Mets have won the World Series!?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Murphy

questions.question: Canyoning is the extreme sport of travelling down canyons, using which of the following techniques?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Parkour, a relatively new sport of physical strength and agility, is usually practised in what kind of surroundings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Urban areas

questions.question: Roger Clemens started game 6 of the 1986 World Series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Susan Oliver, an American actress and television director of the 50s and 60s, was keen on what unusual sport?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Air racing

questions.question: Ray Knight was the regular starting second baseman for the Mets throughout 1986.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This sport, whereby the player navigates the playing field on horseback, is the national game of Argentina.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pato

questions.question: Pole vaulting, an athletics jumping discipline event, in which competitors use a long, flexible pole to leap over a bar, is under what number in the decathlon order?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eight

questions.question: Kart racing, a sport that originated in the 1950s in the United States, was created and popularised in which of these professional fields?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Military air forces

questions.question: Which of the following sports is a fictional one and exists only in the imaginary world of a popular US science fiction movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Podracing

questions.question: Bocce, a sport that developed into its present form in Italy, is classified as what type of sports activity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Target sport

questions.question: The javelin discipline has been part of the Summer Olympics since what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1908

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Reds and Year
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, perez, squash. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many total wins did Jack Billingham have as a Reds pitcher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 75

questions.question: Who managed the Reds to the World Series victory in 1975?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sparky Anderson

questions.question: Floorball, a type of team sport popular in Sweden, Finland and Switzerland, is similar to which of these popular sports?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ice hockey

questions.question: What year was Ewell Blackwell elected to the Reds Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1960

questions.question: What year was Tom Seaver elected to the Reds Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2006

questions.question: What year was Tony Perez elected to the Reds Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1998

questions.question: According to volleyball official rules, touching the net during play is not considered a fault in which case?

options.text: Touching the net with a part of ones clothing

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Touching the net with hair

questions.question: This baseball player and manager, nicknamed The Ol Professor, said, Sports do not  build character. They reveal it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Casey Stengel

questions.question: This baseball player won the National League Most Valuable Player Award in 1975 and 1976  while playing with the Reds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Morgan

questions.question: In squash, small coloured dots on the ball indicate the level of bounciness, hence the skills needed to handle the ball. According to the Professional Squash Association standards, what does the red colour indicate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Medium ball

questions.question: George Foster played primarily third base for the Reds during the 1970s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What coach does this quote belong to: If the NBA were on Channel 5 and a bunch of frogs were making love on Channel 4, I would watch the frogs  even if the picture was coming in fuzzy.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bobby Knight

questions.question: Joe Nuxhall was only 15 when he made his major league debut with the Cincinnati Reds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: How many times was Johnny Vander Meer selected to the National League All-star team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: Boules is a collective name for a number of games played with what type of balls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Metal balls

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Giants and Beijing
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, outfielder, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who won the first gold medal of the 2008 Olympics in Beijing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katerina Emmons (Czech Republic, shooting)

questions.question: What NFL safety made this witty remark: Most football teams are tempermental. Thats 90% temper and 10 % mental.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Doug Plank

questions.question: Who was the Giants running back in Super Bowl XXI?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Morris

questions.question: Several countries had only one representative at the 2008 Olympic Games. Which is not one of them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Timor-Leste

questions.question: What was the nickname of the American mens basketball team at the Olympic Games held in Beijing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Redeem Team

questions.question: What sportswriter specializing in golf remarked: The bell that tolls for all in boxing is the cash register.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Verdi

questions.question: The 1986-87 NFC Championship game was at Giants Stadium in a cold, blustery evening with a mean, swirling wind. The Giants won 17-0 over which division rival?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Washington Redskins

questions.question: What role did Brad Pitt play at the 2008 Summer Olympic Games?

options.text: He was an umpire in the baseball tournament
He presented the last gold medal to Michael Phelps
He fought in the boxing tournament and was eliminated in the first round
He organized a pro-Tibet march in Hong-Kong

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He fought in the boxing tournament and was eliminated in the first round

questions.question: According to the official classification, which country won the medal count at the Olympic Games held in Beijing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China

questions.question: The Giants finished the 1986 regular season at 15-1 and were the NFC East Champions heading to the playoffs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who was the MVP of Super Bowl XXI?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phil Simms

questions.question: In 1985, the Giants were so close to the Super Bowl they could taste it. But one forbidding defensive team with a monster coach stopped them dead in their tracks and went on to win the big game themselves. Name that team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago Bears

questions.question: The New York football Giants defeated the Denver Broncos in Super Bowl XXI in a convincing fashion. What was the final score?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 39-20

questions.question: Who said: You win some, you lose some, you crash some.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dale Earnhardt

questions.question: This running back and an outfielder said, Football is easy if a person is crazy as hell.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bo Jackson

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Athletics and Stipulation
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, athletics, billionaires. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which National Olympic Committee organized Equestrian events during the 2008 Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: NOC of Hong-Kong

questions.question: On the first day of the 2008 Olympic Games, three American women took all medals in which event?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fencing - sabre

questions.question: Who won the 2008 Royal Rumble?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Cena

questions.question: What is The Undertakers streak at WrestleMania (prior to WrestleMania 24)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 15-0

questions.question: India is the second most populous country in the world, but their first individual Olympic gold came only at the 2008 Games. Which was the historical discipline?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shooting

questions.question: Who won the mens tennis competition at the Olympic Games in 2008?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rafael Nadal (Spain)

questions.question: At New Years Revolution 2007, the WWE Womens Champion was Mickie James. Who did she face?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Victoria

questions.question: At the 2006 Unforgiven PPV, there was a Womens Championship Match between Lita and Trish Stratus. What was the stipulation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: There was no stipulation

questions.question: Who returned at Survivor Series 2007 after a 4-month absence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edge

questions.question: At WM 23, what was the stipulation of the Battle of the Billionaires?

options.text: Loser gets humiliated big time, anywhere

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Loser gets head shaved bald

questions.question: Mens Gymnastics at Beijing Olympic Games was dominated by Chinese athletes. Who was the only gold medalist from a different country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leszek Blanik (Poland, vault)

questions.question: During the 2008 Olympics, the 12-years old record of Michael Johnson in 200m run was broken. What was the new time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 19.30s

questions.question: In which volleyball finals did USA participate, in the 2008 Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both

questions.question: How many countries were represented by athletes of Chinese origin at the 2008 Olympic Games table tennis competitions?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 21

questions.question: Athletics is called the queen of all sports. Who won the first gold in athletics during the 2008 Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tomasz Majewski (Poland, shot put)

options.text: It is all about the Gold

options.text: They distract drivers while in the car.
They get thrown on the track

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are considered bad luck.

questions.question: What does NASCAR stand for?

options.text: National Association for Street Car Auto Racing
National Alliance for Sports Car Auto Racing
National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing
Non Athletic Sport Centered Around Rednecks
